intro: Cuphea llavea f. barbigera, commonly known as the featherflower or purple cuphea, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular, violet-pink flowers that resemble feathers. The plant features hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens. Its unique floral structure and vibrant color make it a visually appealing addition to landscapes.
